reviewText: This is probably the best Teddy P. concert DVD out.  He does all the hits he had out at the time.  I didn't realize what a great showman he was.  It was clear that every woman in the audience felt like he was singing directly to them.  Sound and video quality are good as you can expect.  Not 5:1, but it's in stereo and sounded good on my home theatre system.  If you like Teddy P., don't miss this.
summary: So Good We Watched It Again

reviewText: As an ole skool fan of Teddy, I was very pleased to see him in his prime!!  I highly recommend this DVD for any Teddybear fan..it's a must.The only draw back I can say, is that it's not enough of his better hits, Love TKE, Come and go with me...etc.That still being said, I totally enjoyed this DVD.I hope to see others in the future!!

reviewText: ALL THE REVIEWS HAVE JUST SAID IT ALL-IT'S TRUE ABOUT THE GREAT SHOW TEDDY HAS PERFORMED.I AM HAROLD MELVIN AND THE BLUENOTES FAN EVEN TODAY,AND I REALLY ENJOY THEIR VOICES(TEDDY PENDAGRASS,LATE HAROLD MELVIN,GILBERT SAUNDERS AND DONNEL"BIG DADDY"GILLESPIE.AS TEDDY WAS SINGING THE BLUENOTES MEDLEY,IT WAS NOT ENOUGH TO ME AND I WONDER IF SHOUT FACTORY IS GOING TO RELEASE TEDDY WITH THE BLUENOTES BECAUSE THAT'S WHERE WE NEED TO SEE TP.I USED TO ENJOY THE ALBUM OF THAT SHOW"LIVE COAST TO COAST" AND IT WAS ENTERTAINING.ARE YOU  TEDDY OR BLUENOTES FAN?THEN DO NOT MISS THIS DVD.GOD BLESS SHOUT FACTORY.

reviewText: Hello, I see it says CLosed Captioned listed for this DVD up top near the Picture of Teddy. However having had a few DVD's that have this listed on this site and even ON THE BOX! when I open it and bring up on TV as it starts up, there isnt any closed captioned choices on the menu. Yes I know how to find it. I have been using CC for some 10 years now. its not me of my tv. If it does not say it on the menu then it doesnt have it. even if it says it on the back of the box. so if anyone can play it for me and try it, then I can buy it if so, let me know, thank you in advance.

reviewText: Teddy Live in '79? It's O K. But, if you really want to see Teddy you've got to find Live In London 1982, just before the accident. Now, that is Teddy Pendergrass at his best. A tight band, great background singers and TP in all his glory. Somebody please, let's get the good stuff out there.

reviewText: Teddy Pendergrass was running things back in the day for a while. He is underrated to me because you see a Cat who had a rawness in his musical presentation,but had a voice that struck a chord. this concert shows a Artist in his prime&very much in tune with his audeince.the Chicks back in the day especially around my old hood loved them some Teddy P. the fellas respected his voice&he also had songs that were direct&to the point just as his vocal presentation.
summary: Teddy was Badd during his prime

reviewText: The former lead singer of Harold Melvin and the Blue Notes, takes stage center in lake Tahoe at the approximate end of the Disco era (record-wise) and delivers some of the best Disco-Soul ever done, incorporating Blue Note and solo material.Highlights: Life is a Song...; All By Myself (a chance to show off his *voice*);When Somebody Loves You back (featuring beautiful ladies from the audience, dueting with the star); Get Up, Get Down...Audio is okay - though recorded on 24 track, it sounds second-generation monophonic; video is also just marginally good. This reviewer found nothing seriously wrong with the quality.A very important detail for me is the camera work and editing. Long before the hyperactive camera of today and the exclusion of the crowd in the cinematograhy, this production features the enthralled attendees, giving it that "party" atmosphere - guess in 2011 we've gotten too sophisticated.Minor observation: TP opens the show in one of the strangest outfits I've ever encountered as a viewer, something of a wrap-around white cape, possibly something Little Richard dropped off at the GoodWill center in 1972; apparently a Dodge Dart tarpelin, fashioned into flambouyant stage attire. Later, he relinquishes the garb, and we see a well-fitted, long sleeve white shirt and loose fitting white pants. Looks pretty cool. But...the shirt is remove3d and the dude is wearinga white A-shirt from Sears. Well, it was the '70s...it was Vegas. Perhaps the bad taste but hip thing had not worn off since Elvis at the Hilton.Overall, I would place this video right up there with JAMES BROWN AND HIS VERY SPECIAL GUEST, B. B. KING, another show which captures an event in its' entirety, including crowd shots, and an exceptionally strong back-up. As vintage solo act Soul shows go, there are very, very few representative offers out there. If there are, please let me know, in "Comments".Important feature: a great one on one interview at Teddy's Philadelphia home, around 2002. He really brings it all up-to-date for the more casual fan.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Teddy Pendergrass was one of the last great voices in R&B before the genre went belly up in the eighties. Teddy delivered both suave and gritty Soul in an era when disco and radio formats started to reign. His performances were at the same time highly erotic and uninhibited macho. With his mighty and gruff pipes he blew away the competition but could be very tender as well. Teddy is best known for his silky albums but was a mean live performer to boot. So naturally any live DVD should be welcomed. But as with many DVD releases of classic Soul artists this release just doesn't suffice. Although I wouldn't want to argue about the quality of the material that is there, which is exhilarating, it just isn't enough. This release features only eight songs and very little interesting bonus material. I guess we'll have to do with this very meager release. But I keep hoping for a DVD that does Teddy justice.
Title: N/A
